newsitem.title: ABU DHABI: UAE's Union National Bank gets BankWatch ratings.
newsitem.headline: UAE's Union National Bank gets BankWatch ratings.

text.p: U.S. rating agency Thomson BankWatch said on Thursday it assigned ratings to Union National Bank (UNB) of the United Arab Emirates.
BankWatch said in a statement it assigned an intra-country issuer rating of IC-B, a short-term local currency debt rating of LC-1 and a senior debt rating of A- to the UNB.

"Union National Bank now has a sound reputation and a reasonably healthy balance sheet. Loans comprise a sizable 74 percent of total assets, but liquidity is satisfactory," said the statement which was faxed to Reuters.
"Profitability improved greatly in the past two years and prospects are encouraging for this year," it added.
The bank is a former affiliate of the failed Bank of Credit and Commerce International (BCCI).

As of the fourth quarter of 1996, the bank is 40 percent owned by the Abu Dhabi Investment Authority (the investment arm of UAE-member Abu Dhabi), 10 percent by Abu Dhabi itself, and 10 percent by the UAE emirate of Dubai, the statement said.
